question:
Select the INCORRECT statement from the following.

SSC MTS 21/10/2024(3rd Shift)
option_1: The development of the cotton textile industry in Britain led to the decline of Indian textile producers.
option_2: Cotton clothes made in England had driven Indian clothes out of the markets of Europe and America in the beginning of the 20th century.
option_3: The Sale and Devang communities of South India were famous for weaving.
option_4: The first cotton textile mill in India was established in Bombay in 1854.
solution:
• Incorrect Statement: (b) “Cotton clothes made in England had driven Indian clothes out of the markets of Europe and America in the beginning of the 20th century”
  • Indian textiles had already lost global markets by the early 19th century, not the 20th
  • The Industrial Revolution in Britain led to mass machine-made cotton cloth which displaced Indian handmade textiles
  • British economic policies favored British exports while restricting Indian textile trade
  • By the 20th century, India had already become a raw material supplier, not a textile exporter

Additional Information:

  • The first cotton textile mill in India was established in Bombay (Mumbai) in 1854
  • Sale and Devang communities were traditional weaving groups in South India
  • British imposed import duties on Indian textiles while exporting their own goods to Indian markets freely
  • This led to the decline of Indian artisans and boosted British textile dominance

question:
Identify the oldest iron and steel company of India from the following options.

SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (1st Shift)
option_1: Tata Iron & Steel Company (TISCO)
option_2: Visvesvaraiya Iron & Steel Works
option_3: Indian Iron & Steel Company (IISCO)
option_4: Mysore Iron & Steel Works
solution:
• Correct Answer: (a) Tata Iron & Steel Company (TISCO)
  • TISCO is the oldest iron and steel company in India, established in 1907 in Jamshedpur, Jharkhand
  • It was founded by Jamsetji Tata, making it a landmark in Indian industrialization
  • TISCO was later renamed as Tata Steel and became the first private sector steel plant in India
  • It played a significant role in India's industrial development and still remains a leading steel producer

Additional Information:

  • Visvesvaraiya Iron & Steel Works was established in 1923 in Bhadravati, Karnataka
  • Indian Iron & Steel Company (IISCO) was established in 1918 and later merged with SAIL
  • Mysore Iron & Steel Works started in 1923 and was the first public sector steel plant in India

question:
Identify the group of districts that are NOT an example of industrial districts of India.

SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• Correct Answer: (c) Alwar and Bhiwani
  • Alwar and Bhiwani are not known as major industrial districts at the national level compared to others in the list
  • These districts have limited industrial presence, mostly in small-scale or local industries
  • In contrast, Cuttack (Odisha), Kota (Rajasthan), Kanpur and Agra (Uttar Pradesh), and Jabalpur and Bhopal (Madhya Pradesh) are recognized for various large or medium-scale industries
  • Therefore, the pair Alwar and Bhiwani stands out as not being prominent industrial hubs

Additional Information:

  • Kanpur is known for leather, textiles, and defense industries, while Agra is famous for leather and handicrafts
  • Kota is known for engineering goods and fertilizers, and Cuttack for handloom and textiles
  • Jabalpur and Bhopal are noted for defense, engineering, and electrical industries
  • Alwar and Bhiwani are more prominent in agriculture and local trade rather than industrial manufacturing

question:
Which of the following is a public sector industry ?

SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• BHEL (Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited) is a public sector undertaking owned by the Government of India
  • It functions under the Ministry of Heavy Industries and specializes in engineering and manufacturing of power and industrial equipment
  • Public sector industries are those where the government holds the majority ownership
  • Reliance, Tata, and Adani are all private sector companies managed by business groups
  • Therefore, BHEL is the only public sector industry among the given options

Additional Information:

  • BHEL was established in 1964 and is one of India’s largest engineering companies
  • It serves core sectors like power, transportation, renewable energy, and defense
  • Reliance (Mukesh Ambani), Tata (Tata Sons), and Adani (Gautam Adani) are leaders in the private sector

question:
Which of the following is an example of a major industrial region of India?

SSC CGL18/09/2024 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• Chota Nagpur region is a major industrial region of India located primarily in Jharkhand, Odisha, and Chhattisgarh
  • It is rich in mineral resources like coal, iron ore, bauxite, and manganese, which form the backbone of heavy industries
  • The region has a high concentration of iron and steel plants, thermal power stations, and other heavy industries
  • Cities like Jamshedpur, Bokaro, Dhanbad, and Rourkela are key industrial centers in this belt
  • Other options like Bhojpur-Munger, Jaipur-Ajmer, and Bilaspur-Korba are not classified among India’s major industrial regions

Additional Information:

  • The Chota Nagpur Plateau is often referred to as the "Ruhr of India" due to its heavy industrial concentration
  • Jamshedpur is home to Tata Steel, one of India’s oldest and largest steel plants
  • The region is supported by abundant coal supply, making it ideal for thermal power and metallurgical industries

question:
Where was the first successful textile mill established in India?

SSC CGL25/09/2024 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• The first successful textile mill in India was established in Mumbai (then Bombay) in 1854
  • It marked the beginning of the modern cotton textile industry in India
  • Mumbai became the center of India’s textile boom due to its humid climate, port access, and proximity to cotton-growing regions
  • The mill was called the Bombay Spinning and Weaving Company
  • Other cities like Kolkata, Surat, and Jaipur contributed later but were not the pioneers in textile industrialization

Additional Information:

  • Mumbai's growth as a textile hub earned it the nickname “Manchester of India”
  • The availability of skilled labor, capital investment by Indian entrepreneurs, and transport facilities helped the industry thrive
  • After Mumbai, textile mills also spread to Ahmedabad, Kanpur, and Coimbatore

question:
Where is the oldest centre of lace work located in Gujarat?

SSC CHSL04/07/2024 (3rd shift)
solution:
• The oldest centre of lace work in Gujarat is located in Jamnagar
  • Lace work (Zari or crochet-style embroidery) in Jamnagar has a long-standing cultural and artistic heritage
  • This traditional handcraft is known for its delicate thread work and ornamental designs, often used in garments and decorative textiles
  • While places like Kutch and Ahmedabad are famous for other crafts like bandhani and mirror work, lace work has deep roots in Jamnagar’s artisan community
  • Hence, Jamnagar stands out as the historical hub for lace craftsmanship in Gujarat

Additional Information:

  • Jamnagar lace work often uses fine cotton or silk threads and is practiced mainly by women artisans
  • The products include saris, blouses, borders, and household decorations
  • Gujarat is also known for diverse handicrafts, including patola, embroidery, beadwork, and leather work, each centered in different regions

question:
There is a cable manufacturing facility at HCL in Rupnarainpur. It belongs to which state?

SSC CHSL05/07/2024 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The cable manufacturing facility of HCL (Hindustan Cables Limited) is located in Rupnarainpur, which lies in the state of West Bengal
  • Rupnarainpur is situated in the Asansol industrial region, known for several public sector enterprises
  • HCL is a public sector undertaking under the Ministry of Heavy Industries and has been involved in telecommunication and power cable manufacturing
  • The facility at Rupnarainpur has historically played a role in India’s telecom infrastructure development
  • The other states listed—Haryana, Assam, and Andhra Pradesh—do not house this particular HCL facility

Additional Information:

  • Hindustan Cables Limited was established in 1952 and is one of India’s earliest government-owned cable manufacturers
  • The Rupnarainpur unit specialized in jelly-filled and polythene-insulated cables
  • The region also includes industries related to steel, coal, and heavy engineering, making it a strategic industrial zone

question:
According to the Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion, which of the following is NOT a core industry ?

SSC CHSL08/07/2024 (1st shift)
solution:
• The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) identifies eight core industries that are crucial to India's economy
  • These are: Coal, Crude Oil, Natural Gas, Refinery Products, Fertilizers, Steel, Cement, and Electricity
  • These industries collectively account for 27% of the weight in the Index of Industrial Production (IIP)
  • Jute is not among these eight core industries
  • Therefore, Jute is not considered a core industry according to DPIIT

Additional Information:

  • The Index of Eight Core Industries (ICI) is released monthly by the Office of the Economic Adviser under DPIIT
  • The base year for the ICI is 2011–12
  • The weightage of each core industry in the ICI is as follows:
    • Refinery Products: 28.04%
    • Electricity: 19.85%
    • Steel: 17.92%
    • Coal: 10.33%
    • Crude Oil: 8.98%
    • Natural Gas: 6.88%
    • Cement: 5.37%
    • Fertilizers: 2.63%
  • The performance of these industries serves as a barometer for India's industrial and economic health

question:
Select the INCORRECT pair of the location of the refinery and its state from the following

SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (3rd shift)
option_1: Bina Refinery- Madhya Pradesh
solution:
• Tatipaka Refinery is located in Andhra Pradesh, not Telangana, making option (d) incorrect
  • It is a small-capacity refinery operated by ONGC in East Godavari district, Andhra Pradesh
  • The other refineries are correctly matched:
    • Bina Refinery is in Madhya Pradesh, operated by Bharat Oman Refineries Limited (BPCL subsidiary)
    • Numaligarh Refinery is in Assam, managed by Numaligarh Refinery Limited
    • Koyali Refinery is in Gujarat, near Vadodara, operated by Indian Oil Corporation
  • Therefore, option (d) is the incorrect pair as it mismatches the refinery’s actual state

Additional Information:

  • Tatipaka Refinery is one of the smallest refineries in India, with a capacity of around 066 MMTPA
  • Koyali Refinery is one of the largest IOC refineries, with a refining capacity of over 13 MMTPA
  • Numaligarh Refinery plays a key role in refining and distribution in northeast India
  • Bina Refinery has a strategic location in central India, aiding fuel supply in northern and central regions

question:
Which group of states was concentrated in the cotton production in the early years to develop textile industry?

SSC CHSL11/07/2024 (4th shift)
option_1: West Bengal and Odisha
option_4: Bihar and West Bengal
solution:
• Maharashtra and Gujarat were the leading states in cotton production in the early years of India's textile industry
  • Their warm climate, fertile black soil, and proximity to cotton-growing regions made them ideal for setting up cotton-based industries
  • Major textile hubs like Mumbai (formerly Bombay) and Ahmedabad emerged in these states, earning titles like “Manchester of India”
  • The presence of ports, labor, and capital further supported industrial growth in this region
  • Other state groups like West Bengal–Odisha or Bihar–West Bengal were not significant cotton producers

Additional Information:

  • Mumbai became a major center for cotton mills by the late 19th century
  • Ahmedabad was known for its spinning and weaving mills and was referred to as the “Manchester of the East”
  • These states continue to be dominant players in India's textile and garment industries
  • Gujarat is still the largest cotton producer in India today

question:
Where was the first cement plant located in India in the year 1904 ?

Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift- 1)
solution:
• The first cement plant in India was established in the year 1904 at Chennai (then Madras), Tamil Nadu
  • It was set up by the company South India Industrial Ltd. and marked the beginning of the Indian cement industry
  • This plant was of small capacity and used wet process technology, laying the foundation for future expansion
  • Over time, more cement plants were developed in central and western India, but Chennai was the pioneer
  • The other cities listed—Jaipur, Rajkot, and Kolkata—were not the location of India’s first cement plant

Additional Information:

  • India is currently the second-largest producer of cement in the world after China
  • Major cement-producing states include Andhra Pradesh, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat
  • The development of the cement industry is crucial for infrastructure, housing, and industrial growth

question:
Which group of oilfields among the following is located in Assam?

Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift- 1)
solution:
• Digboi and Naharkatiya are oilfields located in Assam, making option (a) correct
  • Digboi is India’s oldest oilfield, where oil was first discovered in 1889, and the first refinery was commissioned in 1901
  • Naharkatiya is another major oilfield in Upper Assam, discovered in 1953
  • These oilfields are managed by Oil India Limited (OIL) and play a significant role in India's petroleum production
  • Other options include oilfields located in Gujarat, not Assam

Additional Information:

  • Ankaleshwar, Kalol, Mehsana, Nawagam, Kosamba, and Lunej are all major oil-producing fields in the state of Gujarat
  • Assam remains a key contributor to India’s crude oil output, especially from the Brahmaputra valley
  • The Digboi refinery is still operational and holds historical importance in India’s energy sector

question:
Which of the following cities is called the Silicon Valley of India due to its prominence in the IT industry ?

Matriculation Level 24/06/2024 (Shift- 4)
solution:
• Bengaluru is popularly known as the "Silicon Valley of India" due to its leading role in the IT and software industry
  • The city hosts major Indian and global IT firms, including Infosys, Wipro, TCS, and IBM
  • It has a well-developed ecosystem of tech parks, R&D centers, skilled professionals, and startup incubators
  • Bengaluru's growth in the IT sector began in the 1980s and has since evolved into a global technology hub
  • Other cities like Hyderabad and Gurugram are IT hubs, but Bengaluru leads in scale and recognition

Additional Information:

  • Bengaluru is the capital of Karnataka and contributes significantly to India’s software exports and digital economy
  • The presence of top engineering institutes like IISc and IIIT-B boosts its innovation ecosystem
  • The city is also a center for aerospace, biotechnology, and electronics industries

question:
Which of the following is the only vertically-integrated, primary copper producer in India ?

SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution:
• Hindustan Copper Limited (HCL) is the only vertically integrated, primary copper producer in India
  • It is a Central Public Sector Undertaking (CPSU) under the Ministry of Mines, Government of India
  • HCL's operations encompass the entire copper production process:
    • Mining
    • Beneficiation
    • Smelting
    • Refining
    • Casting of refined copper metal
  • HCL's facilities are spread across various states:
    • Malanjkhand Copper Project (MCP) in Madhya Pradesh
    • Khetri Copper Complex (KCC) in Rajasthan
    • Indian Copper Complex (ICC) in Jharkhand
    • Taloja Copper Project (TCP) in Maharashtra
    • Gujarat Copper Project (GCP) in Gujarat
  • Other companies like Sterlite Industries, Jhagadia Copper Limited, and Hindalco Industries (Birla Copper) are involved in copper production but do not have fully integrated operations from mining to final product

Additional Information:

  • HCL was incorporated on 9th November 1967
  • It is recognized as a Miniratna Category-I company
  • HCL's product range includes:
    • Copper cathodes
    • Continuous cast copper rods
    • By-products such as anode slime (containing gold, silver, etc.), copper sulphate, and sulphuric acid
  • The company's operations are crucial for India's strategic metal requirements and contribute significantly to the national economy

question:
At which of the following places was the shipbuilding industry started in 1941?

SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Evening)
solution:
• The shipbuilding industry was started in 1941 at Vishakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh
  • This was the site where the Hindustan Shipyard Limited (HSL) was established (initially as Scindia Shipyard)
  • It played a key role in building merchant and naval vessels during World War II and post-independence
  • The location was strategically chosen due to its deep-water port, naval access, and proximity to the Bay of Bengal
  • The other places listed—Damodar, Eluru, and Kurnool—have no historical linkage to the origin of shipbuilding in India

Additional Information:

  • Hindustan Shipyard Limited was formally inaugurated in 1941 and later taken over by the Government of India in 1961
  • It is now under the administrative control of the Ministry of Defence
  • The shipyard handles construction, repair, and retrofitting of naval and commercial ships
  • Vishakhapatnam is also home to other key naval installations like the Eastern Naval Command

question:
The Kolar region of Karnataka is famous for which mineral from the following ?

SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (1st Shift)
solution:
• The Kolar region of Karnataka is historically famous for gold mining
  • It is home to the Kolar Gold Fields (KGF), which were among the deepest and oldest gold mines in the world
  • Gold mining in KGF began during the British colonial era and contributed significantly to India’s gold production
  • The mines were closed in 2001 due to high production costs and declining yield but remain a symbol of India’s mining history
  • The other minerals—coal, petroleum, and copper—are not primarily associated with the Kolar region

Additional Information:

  • Kolar Gold Fields are located in Kolar district, around 100 km from Bengaluru
  • The mines were operated by Bharat Gold Mines Limited (BGML)
  • KGF once had British-style infrastructure, including a golf course, theater, and housing colonies for miners
  • The area has gained renewed interest due to pop culture references, including the movie "KGF"

question:
Which state in India has the highest number of aluminium smelting plants?

SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• Odisha has the highest number of aluminium smelting plants in India.
  • The state is home to major aluminium producers like National Aluminium Company (NALCO) and Vedanta Aluminium, with significant smelting facilities in Angul and Jharsuguda, respectively.
  • Odisha's rich bauxite reserves and robust power infrastructure have made it a hub for aluminium production.
  • Other states like Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, and Uttar Pradesh have aluminium plants, but they are fewer in number and capacity compared to Odisha.

Additional Information:

  • Jharsuguda is often referred to as the "Powerhouse of Odisha" due to its extensive metallurgical industries, including aluminium smelting.
  • Hirakud in Sambalpur district houses a significant aluminium smelter operated by Hindalco Industries.

question:
Which of the following industries is its own major consumer in India?

SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (1st shift)
solution:
• The chemical industry in India is considered a major consumer of its own products
  • Many chemical products such as acids, solvents, dyes, and intermediates are used internally within the industry to manufacture other chemicals
  • For example, sulphuric acid is used to produce fertilizers, detergents, and other chemicals—all within the chemical sector itself
  • This self-consumption pattern is a unique characteristic of the diverse and interconnected nature of the chemical industry
  • In contrast, industries like iron and steel, aviation, and automobile primarily serve external sectors or consumers

Additional Information:

  • The Indian chemical industry contributes to over 80,000 commercial products
  • It plays a central role in agriculture, textiles, pharmaceuticals, and manufacturing
  • India ranks as the 6th largest producer of chemicals in the world by output
  • The sector also supports exports of dyes, organic/inorganic chemicals, and specialty chemicals

question:
Which city in India is known as the ‘Detroit of India’ due to its automobile industry?

SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• Chennai is known as the ‘Detroit of India’ because of its large concentration of automobile and auto-component manufacturing units
  • The city is home to major Indian and international automobile companies like Hyundai, Ford (formerly), Nissan, Ashok Leyland, TVS, and BMW
  • Chennai contributes to over 30% of India’s automobile industry and around 35% of auto components production
  • The term “Detroit of India” draws a parallel with Detroit, USA, which was historically the global hub for the automobile sector
  • Other cities like Mumbai, Bengaluru, and Pune have automobile industries but not as dominant as Chennai

Additional Information:

  • Chennai has several automobile hubs such as Sriperumbudur and Oragadam
  • The region also supports a robust supply chain, engineering talent, and port access for exports
  • The Tamil Nadu government offers strong policy support, making it an attractive destination for auto investment

question:
The Kudremukh Mines are located in which of the following states?

SSC CHSL 04/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• Kudremukh Mines are located in the state of Karnataka, specifically in the Chikkamagaluru district
  • These mines are known for their large reserves of iron ore and were operated by Kudremukh Iron Ore Company Limited (KIOCL), a public sector enterprise
  • Kudremukh was one of the largest iron ore mining projects in India and was unique for its open-pit mining operations in a forested hill region
  • The mined ore was transported through a slurry pipeline to Mangaluru port, where it was processed and exported
  • The other states listed—Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra, and Odisha—have iron ore deposits but do not host Kudremukh Mines

Additional Information:

  • The Kudremukh mines are located within the Western Ghats, a UNESCO World Heritage site known for biodiversity
  • Mining operations were halted in 2005 due to environmental concerns, and the area is now part of the Kudremukh National Park
  • Despite the closure, KIOCL continues to operate a pellet plant in Mangaluru and remains a key player in the iron ore sector

question:
In which of the following regions in India are there high-grade iron ore deposits?

SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution:
• Northern Odisha is rich in high-grade iron ore deposits, making it the correct answer
  • The region includes major iron ore belts such as Keonjhar, Sundargarh, and Mayurbhanj, which are known for hematite ores with high iron content (above 60%)
  • These ores are essential for steel production, and Odisha is a leading state in iron ore output in India
  • The deposits are extensively mined by public and private sector companies like SAIL and Tata Steel
  • Other regions like Western Rajasthan, Southern Punjab, and Eastern Uttar Pradesh do not have significant iron ore reserves

Additional Information:

  • Barbil–Joda region in Keonjhar district is a major iron ore mining area in Odisha
  • Odisha contributes over 50% of India’s iron ore production
  • The Chhota Nagpur Plateau region, which extends into northern Odisha, is part of the rich mineral belt of India

question:
Which is the first integrated steel plant in the public sector in India?

SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (1st shift)
option_1: The Visvesvaraya Iron and Steel Limited
option_3: The Salem Steel Plant
option_4: Indian Iron and Steel Company
solution:
• The Rourkela Steel Plant was the first integrated steel plant in the public sector in India
  • It was established in 1954 in Rourkela, Odisha with technical and financial assistance from Germany
  • An "integrated steel plant" means it carries out the entire process — from raw material handling to steel making and rolling
  • It is operated by Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL), a major PSU in the steel sector
  • The other options are not the first public sector integrated plants:
    • Visvesvaraya Iron and Steel Limited was a state-owned unit but not fully integrated at first
    • Salem Steel Plant and Indian Iron and Steel Company (IISCO) came later or were under private/other arrangements before merging into the public sector

Additional Information:

  • Rourkela Steel Plant was one of the first three steel plants set up after independence, along with Bhilai (with Soviet aid) and Durgapur (with British aid)
  • These plants were part of Nehru’s vision of industrializing India through public sector enterprises
  • Rourkela is still one of the largest steel-producing units under SAIL

question:
Which is the oldest aluminium refinery plant in India?

SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (2nd shift)
option_2: The Muri Alumina Plant
solution:
• The Muri Alumina Plant is the oldest aluminium refinery plant in India
  • It was established in 1948 in Jharkhand (then Bihar) and is operated by Hindalco Industries, a part of the Aditya Birla Group
  • The plant processes bauxite to produce alumina, which is further used in aluminium smelting
  • This refinery marked the beginning of India’s aluminium refining industry
  • The other plants—Damanjodi, Mettur, and Belgaum—were established later and are not the oldest

Additional Information:

  • Damanjodi Plant (NALCO) was commissioned in 1987 in Odisha
  • Belgaum Plant (Hindalco) is located in Karnataka and began operations in the 1960s
  • Mettur Plant is a smaller facility located in Tamil Nadu
  • The Muri plant still plays an important role in alumina production for aluminium smelters across India

question:
Which of the following is NOT an example of a minor industrial region of India?

Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift- 4)
solution:
• The Hugli region is not a minor industrial region; it is classified as a major industrial region of India
  • Located in West Bengal, the Hugli Industrial Region includes Kolkata and its surroundings and is one of the oldest and most important industrial belts in India
  • It has a wide range of industries including jute, textiles, engineering, chemicals, paper, and food processing
  • In contrast, regions like Ambala-Amritsar, Durg-Raipur, and Northern Malabar are considered minor industrial regions based on scale, diversity, and industrial concentration
  • Hence, option (c) Hugli region is not a minor industrial region, making it the correct answer

Additional Information:

  • Hugli Industrial Region developed due to river access, rail connectivity, port facilities, and British-era investments
  • It includes industrial towns like Kolkata, Howrah, Serampore, and Haldia
  • It is known especially for the jute industry, earning Kolkata the title "Jute capital of the world"
  • Minor industrial regions usually have localized or single-industry dominance, unlike major regions with diverse and large-scale industries

question:
In the beginning of the 19th century cotton mills in India were mostly located in which of the following states?

SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• In the beginning of the 19th century, cotton mills in India were mostly located in Maharashtra, particularly in Mumbai (then Bombay)
  • The first successful cotton textile mill in India was established in Mumbai in 1854, marking the start of large-scale industrialization in the region
  • Maharashtra’s favorable climate, availability of raw cotton, skilled labor, and proximity to port facilities made it ideal for cotton textile production
  • Other states like Assam, Punjab, and Haryana did not have significant cotton mill presence during that period

Additional Information:

  • Mumbai was referred to as the “Manchester of India” due to its booming textile industry
  • The cotton textile industry later expanded to Ahmedabad (Gujarat) and other parts of the country
  • The growth of the industry played a key role in the economic transformation during British rule

question:
With respect to value addition in the textile industry, knitting is followed by which procedure?

SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Morning)
solution:
• In the textile value chain, knitting is a process that converts yarn into fabric by inter-looping the yarns
  • The step that typically follows knitting is dyeing and finishing, which enhances the appearance, texture, color, and functionality of the fabric
  • Dyeing gives the fabric color, while finishing involves treatments like softening, shrinking control, waterproofing, etc.
  • This step is essential before the fabric is used for garment manufacturing or other end-use applications
  • Hence, the correct answer is (d) Dyeing and finishing

Additional Information:

  • The general order in textile processing is:

    Fiber production → Spinning → Knitting/Weaving → Dyeing and Finishing → Garment Manufacture

  • Spinning converts fibers into yarn, which is used in knitting/weaving
  • Garment manufacture comes after the fabric is dyed and finished

question:
Which of the following is dark reddish coloured stone used as raw material in aluminum smelting?

SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Afternoon)
solution:
• The dark reddish coloured stone used as a raw material in aluminium smelting is Bauxite
  • Bauxite is the primary ore of aluminium and contains high amounts of aluminium oxide (Al₂O₃)
  • It has a distinctive reddish-brown color due to the presence of iron oxides
  • In the smelting process, bauxite is first refined to produce alumina, which is then electrolyzed to obtain aluminium metal
  • Other options like mica, gypsum, and conglomerate are not used in aluminium production

Additional Information:

  • Major bauxite-producing states in India include Odisha, Gujarat, Jharkhand, Maharashtra, and Chhattisgarh
  • The Bayer process is used to extract alumina from bauxite
  • The Hall-Héroult process is used for the electrolytic reduction of alumina to produce aluminium

question:
The Paithani saree weaving industry is in which state?

SSC MTS 06/10/2021(Evening)
solution:
• The Paithani saree weaving industry is located in the state of Maharashtra
  • These sarees are traditionally handwoven silk sarees known for their rich zari borders and intricate peacock or floral motifs
  • The name "Paithani" comes from the town of Paithan, situated in the Aurangabad district of Maharashtra
  • This saree is often considered a royal garment and is an important part of Maharashtrian bridal wear and festivals
  • Other states like Rajasthan, Gujarat, and Assam have their own famous saree traditions, but Paithani is unique to Maharashtra

Additional Information:

  • Paithani sarees are made using pure silk and gold or silver threads (zari)
  • The art of Paithani weaving is over 2,000 years old, with roots tracing back to the Satavahana dynasty
  • It is considered a GI (Geographical Indication) tagged product, recognizing its regional and cultural identity

question:
Imphal valley of Manipur is an important center of ________ craft.

SSC MTS 07/10/2021(Morning)
solution:
• The Imphal Valley of Manipur is a prominent center of Kauna craft
  • Kauna refers to a type of water reed grass that grows abundantly in the wetlands of Manipur
  • This craft involves weaving Kauna grass into mats, baskets, bags, and furniture
  • It is an eco-friendly and sustainable handicraft, widely practiced by local artisans, especially women
  • The other options—Godna, Butta, and Mirijims—belong to different regions and crafts unrelated to Manipur

Additional Information:

  • Kauna grass is soft, flexible, and suitable for weaving
  • The craft not only provides livelihood to many rural families in Manipur but also promotes traditional handcraft preservation
  • Godna is a tattoo art form from Bihar, Butta refers to embroidery from South India, and Mirijims are handwoven carpets from Tamil Nadu

question:
Which is the second most important metallurgical industry in India?

SSC MTS 07/10/2021(Morning)
solution:
• The second most important metallurgical industry in India after iron and steel is aluminium
  • Aluminium is a lightweight, corrosion-resistant, and high-conductivity metal, making it essential for sectors like transport, construction, packaging, and aerospace
  • India has large reserves of bauxite, the primary ore of aluminium, which supports the growth of this industry
  • Major aluminium producers in India include NALCO, Vedanta Aluminium, and Hindalco
  • While copper and zinc are important, their production and industrial scale are smaller compared to aluminium

Additional Information:

  • India is among the top producers of aluminium globally
  • Odisha, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, and Gujarat are major aluminium-producing states
  • The aluminium industry is crucial for India’s infrastructure and Make-in-India initiative
